Context:
The college has launched a new e-course titled "Doing the Work: An Introduction to Anti-Racism." This course can be accessed by employees via Cornerstone and students on Blackboard. The course uses the five steps of the Take 5 for Anti-Racism: self-reflect, educate, rethink, identify, and engage. The college encourages the entire community to complete the course.

The primer supports the George Brown College community in engaging in anti-racism practice and includes resources for educators to create inclusive learning environments. The college hosted virtual events during Black Futures Month celebrating Black innovation, excellence, and joy. A toolkit is available for leaders to start the dialogue on creating an anti-racist institution.

The contact information provided is 416-415-2000 for regular inquiries and 1-877-515-5559 for TTY inquiries. The email address is ask.george@georgebrown.ca. The college's social media hub can be visited for additional information, and visitors can sign up to receive updates on application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and more.

No specific program information was extracted from the text.
